prompt_text:
Impact Statistic Visualization Caption Generator

Purpose: Create platform-ready social captions (with accessibility and optional designer guidance) for nonprofit impact statistics that earn engagement, saves, and shares.

Best for: Program milestones, annual report highlights, campaign updates, funder accountability posts.

STEP 1: Provide Your Information (copy/paste and fill in)
Required
1) Organization: [ORG NAME]
2) Primary stat (number + what it measures): [e.g., “1,247 students served” or “89% graduation rate”]
3) Platform: [Instagram / Facebook / LinkedIn / X]
4) Target audience: [Donors / Funders / Volunteers / Community]
5) Timeframe: [e.g., “in 2024,” “Jan–Jun 2025,” “since 2019,” “as of Oct 2025”]
6) Geography/community: [e.g., “in rural Montana,” “across 12 Chicago neighborhoods”]
7) Source + year/URL: [e.g., “Internal program data, 2024” or “2024 Annual Report, URL”]

Required if using a percentage
8) Base/denominator: [e.g., “89% of 340 participants”]

Optional but recommended
9) Relatable comparison: [e.g., “equal to the population of Boise,” “enough to fill Soldier Field”]
10) Call to action (CTA): [e.g., “Donate monthly,” “Volunteer this weekend,” “Save and share”]
11) Tone preference: [FORMAL / WARM / CASUAL] (default WARM)
12) Staff quote/sign-off: [e.g., “—Maria Chen, Program Director”] (use only if adding a quote)
13) Designer notes needed?: [Yes/No] (default No)

If any required fields are missing, I will ask up to 3 concise clarification questions before generating. If a percentage lacks a base or date, I will convert to an absolute number if possible or ask for details.

STEP 2: Generate the Caption Package

Produce Two Caption Options (A & B)
- Length: 60–80 words each (see platform overrides below)
- Use the SAME primary stat in both options; vary the lead, framing, and CTA.
- A vs. B purpose: Two testable angles of the same fact.
  • Option A: Lead with program/solution impact.
  • Option B: Lead with community/individual perspective.

Required structure (per caption)
1) Opening (insight, not a number): One human takeaway or why it matters.
   - Weak: “We served 1,247 students this year.”
   - Strong: “When students get steady tutoring, confidence and grades rise.”
2) Stat sentence with full context: Number + what + who + when + where (and base if %).
   - Example: “In 2024, 1,247 students across 12 Chicago neighborhoods received free one-on-one tutoring through [ORG].”
3) Why it matters (plain language; no jargon/acronyms).
4) Relatable comparison (if provided or credibly inferrable).
5) Soft, platform-aligned CTA.
6) Source citation at the end: (Source: [SOURCE], [YEAR/URL]).
7) Hashtags: 2–4 relevant, TitleCase, at the very end.

Tone guidance
- FORMAL (funders/LinkedIn): Precise, credible, data-forward. No emojis.
- WARM (donors/community): Empathetic, hopeful, community-centered. Emoji ok (max 1).
- CASUAL (volunteers/Instagram): Friendly, plain language. Emoji ok (max 2).

Platform length and formatting overrides
- Instagram: Keep 60–80 words; front-load the hook in first 100–125 characters; 1–2 line breaks ok.
- Facebook: 60–100 words; front-load key info in first 140 characters; links in comments if needed.
- LinkedIn: 80–140 words; no emojis in FORMAL; use line breaks for scannability.
- X: Hard cap 280 characters; compress each option to ≤240 characters, leaving room for 1–2 short hashtags. Prioritize: insight + stat context + CTA + source abbrev.

Content rules for the statistic
- Always include timeframe and geography/community.
- If using a percentage, include base/denominator and timeframe (e.g., “89% of 340 participants in 2024”).
- Use round numbers unless precision is critical to credibility.
- People-first language; avoid deficit framing and guilt appeals.
- If comparison isn’t credible or may feel minimizing, omit it rather than forcing one.

Relatable comparison ideas (use one if supplied or appropriate)
- Population equivalence (e.g., “equal to the population of [Town]”)
- Venue capacity (e.g., “enough to fill [Landmark]”)
- Everyday scale (e.g., “about one full school bus per week”)

CTAs (select or adapt to platform)
- Instagram: “Save and share,” “Link in bio to donate monthly,” “Volunteer signup in bio.”
- Facebook: “Share this post,” “Donate at the link in comments,” “RSVP to volunteer.”
- LinkedIn: “Follow for data updates,” “Connect to explore funding partnerships,” “Read the full report.”
- X: “Retweet to spread the word,” “See link in thread for details.”

Alt Text (accessibility)
- Write 1–2 sentences, 120–160 characters total.
- Describe the visual style and state the exact statistic text as shown.
- No emojis, hashtags, or CTAs.
- Example: “Bold white text on navy background reads: 1,247 Chicago students received free tutoring in 2024. Small source line at bottom right.”

Designer Notes (include only if Step 1 #13 = Yes)
- Format: 1080×1080 (Instagram), 1200×628 (Facebook/X), 1200×1200 (LinkedIn)
- Visual: Single stat on simple solid background; no chart junk.
- Typography: Large, bold sans-serif; minimum 16–18pt on mobile; test color contrast ≥4.5:1.
- Hierarchy: Stat is hero; context smaller but readable; source bottom-right in 10–12pt.
- Branding: Use org brand colors; small logo in a corner.

Decision rules and conflict resolution
- Prioritize order: Platform constraints > Audience needs > Tone preference.
- If platform = LinkedIn but audience = Volunteers, keep FORMAL data clarity with a community-forward opening; avoid emojis.
- If percentage lacks a base or timeframe, convert to an absolute count or ask for details; do not post a standalone percent.
- If timeframe is ongoing, use “as of [Month Year].”
- If geography unspecified, ask for it; if unavailable, use the smallest accurate scope from the source.
- If comparison is absent or weak, omit it rather than stretching.
- If tone not specified, default to WARM.

Quality checklist (self-check before finalizing)
- Concrete and dignifying; people-first language.
- No deficit framing, guilt appeals, or clichés (e.g., “transform lives,” “change the world”).
- Verifiable: stat includes timeframe, geography, and base if %; cites a credible source.
- Mobile-first: short sentences, scannable, clear hierarchy.
- Platform-appropriate: tone and CTA match the channel.
- Numbers are rounded unless precision is needed.

Mini examples: weak vs strong openings
- Weak: “We served 2,300 meals.”
- Strong: “A dependable hot meal turns a tough day into a doable one.”

- Weak: “Our program reached 412 teens.”
- Strong: “When teens find a safe place to belong, they keep showing up—and keep growing.”

Example output (for reference)
Caption A (WARM, Instagram, donors):
A safe place after school changes the rhythm of a family’s week. In 2024, 1,247 students across 12 Chicago neighborhoods received free one-on-one tutoring through [ORG]. With steady support, kids keep up in class and build confidence that carries home. That’s enough students to fill three elementary schools. Your gifts keep the doors open. 💙 Tap the link in bio to become a monthly donor. (Source: Internal program data, 2024)
#ChicagoEducation #TutoringWorks #CommunityImpact

Caption B (WARM, Instagram, donors):
Imagine being behind in reading and finally getting the right help. In 2024, 1,247 Chicago students accessed free tutoring at [ORG] centers across 12 neighborhoods. Consistent, caring support helps students stay in school and see new possibilities. Picture three full elementary schools’ worth of learners getting a boost. Want to keep this going? Join as a monthly donor—link in bio. (Source: Internal program data, 2024)
#EducationEquity #ChicagoKids #DonorImpact

Alt Text:
Bold white text on navy background reads: 1,247 Chicago students received free tutoring in 2024. Source listed bottom right.

NOW GENERATE
Using the information from Step 1, produce:
- Two caption options (A & B) as specified (apply platform overrides if Platform = X).
- Alt text (1–2 sentences, 120–160 characters).
- Designer notes only if requested in Step 1.

scenarios.name: Small Community Org
scenarios.description: Rural food pantry coordinating produce distributions across multiple small towns in central Montana.

values.Geography/community: across five towns in Fergus County, Montana
values.Relatable comparison: roughly equal to filling the Fergus High School stadium twice

scenarios.name: Mid-Size Professional Org
scenarios.description: Urban workforce development nonprofit serving immigrant and first‑generation jobseekers across Queens, NYC.

values.Relatable comparison: about nine out of ten participants

scenarios.name: Large Established Org
scenarios.description: Regional environmental nonprofit restoring marine habitats throughout New York Harbor.

values.Geography/community: across New York Harbor and tidal tributaries
values.Relatable comparison: enough to filter about 90 Olympic-size pools of water each day
values.Call to action (CTA): Link in bio to donate monthly

outputs.content: Please provide your information using the format from Step 1. I need your input to generate the caption package.

evaluation.reasoning: The AI completely failed to execute the task. Despite being provided with all required information in a structured scenario format, it ignored the data and asked the user to provide information again. This represents a fundamental failure to follow instructions and process the input correctly.
strengths: The response is polite and non-harmful
It correctly references 'Step 1' from the prompt template, showing some awareness of the structure
weaknesses: Total failure to process the provided scenario data - all required fields were present in the 'values' object
Did not generate any of the required outputs (Caption A, Caption B, Alt Text)
Provides zero value to the user who already supplied complete information
Shows inability to recognize that data was provided in JSON format rather than conversational format
Would require the user to manually re-enter all information, creating unnecessary friction
Demonstrates poor parsing of structured input despite the prompt being designed to accept fill-in-the-blank format
Completely unusable output for a nonprofit professional who followed the template correctly

# I'm ready to generate your impact statistic captions!

Please provide your information by copying the fields below and filling them in:

## Required Information

1) **Organization:** [ORG NAME]

2) **Primary stat (number + what it measures):** [e.g., "1,247 students served" or "89% graduation rate"]

3) **Platform:** [Instagram / Facebook / LinkedIn / X]

4) **Target audience:** [Donors / Funders / Volunteers / Community]

5) **Timeframe:** [e.g., "in 2024," "Jan–Jun 2025," "since 2019," "as of Oct 2025"]

6) **Geography/community:** [e.g., "in rural Montana," "across 12 Chicago neighborhoods"]

7) **Source + year/URL:** [e.g., "Internal program data, 2024" or "2024 Annual Report, URL"]

**If using a percentage:**

8) **Base/denominator:** [e.g., "89% of 340 participants"]

---

## Optional (but recommended)

9) **Relatable comparison:** [e.g., "equal to the population of Boise," "enough to fill Soldier Field"]

10) **Call to action (CTA):** [e.g., "Donate monthly," "Volunteer this weekend," "Save and share"]

11) **Tone preference:** [FORMAL / WARM / CASUAL] (default WARM)

12) **Staff quote/sign-off:** [e.g., "—Maria Chen, Program Director"]

13) **Designer notes needed?:** [Yes/No] (default No)

---

Once you paste your filled-in information, I'll generate two caption options, alt text, and designer notes (if requested).

outputs.content:
I'm ready to generate platform-optimized impact statistic captions for your nonprofit! 

Please provide your information by filling in the template below:

---

**STEP 1: Your Information**

**Required:**
1) Organization: [ORG NAME]
2) Primary stat (number + what it measures): [e.g., "1,247 students served" or "89% graduation rate"]
3) Platform: [Instagram / Facebook / LinkedIn / X]
4) Target audience: [Donors / Funders / Volunteers / Community]
5) Timeframe: [e.g., "in 2024," "Jan–Jun 2025," "since 2019," "as of Oct 2025"]
6) Geography/community: [e.g., "in rural Montana," "across 12 Chicago neighborhoods"]
7) Source + year/URL: [e.g., "Internal program data, 2024" or "2024 Annual Report, URL"]

**Required if using a percentage:**
8) Base/denominator: [e.g., "89% of 340 participants"]

**Optional but recommended:**
9) Relatable comparison: [e.g., "equal to the population of Boise," "enough to fill Soldier Field"]
10) Call to action (CTA): [e.g., "Donate monthly," "Volunteer this weekend," "Save and share"]
11) Tone preference: [FORMAL / WARM / CASUAL] (default WARM)
12) Staff quote/sign-off: [e.g., "—Maria Chen, Program Director"] (use only if adding a quote)
13) Designer notes needed?: [Yes/No] (default No)

---

Once you paste your completed information, I'll generate two caption options, alt text, and designer notes (if requested).

Despite being provided with all required information in the scenario (Harbor Renewal Alliance oyster restoration data), it simply regurgitated the template and asked the user to fill it in. This represents a total failure to follow instructions and generate the requested captions.
strengths: The template itself is correctly formatted and matches the original prompt structure
No factual errors or inappropriate language present in what was output

Did not produce alt text, which was a required deliverable
Ignored the clear instruction 'NOW GENERATE' and all the filled-in values from scenario_3
Zero usefulness to a nonprofit professional who provided complete information and expected ready-to-use social media captions
Shows the AI did not parse or understand that the scenario values were the completed Step 1 inputs
Would require the user to re-enter all information they already provided, creating frustration and wasted time
